title: Samsung Galaxy S23
content:

& 2x2.8 GHz Cortex-A715 & 2x2.8 GHz Cortex-A710 & 3x2.0 GHz Cortex-A510) |'''S23 FE:''' Octa-core (1x2.8 GHz Cortex-X2 & 3x2.50 GHz Cortex-A710 & 4x1.8 GHz Cortex-A510) }}|'''S23/S23+/S23 Ultra:''' | [[Wireless Powershare]] at 4.5W }} | input = * [[S Pen]] stylus (S23 Ultra) * [[Accelerometer]] * [[Barometer]] * [[Fingerprint scanner]] (under display, ultrasonic) * [[Pressure sensor]] * Satellite System|BeiDou]]/[[Galileo (satellite navigation)|Galileo]]) | display = {{unbulleted list | Dynamic [[AMOLED]] 2X, Infinity-O, capacitive touchscreen, [[HDR10+]], 1B colors, peak brightness 1750 nits,
([[PenTile matrix family#PenTile RGBG|Diamond PenTile]]) | '''S23''': {{convert|6.1|in|mm|abbr=on}} {{resx|2340|1080}} (425 ppi), 19.5:9 [[Display aspect ratio|aspect ratio]], 120 Hz [[refresh rate]] | '''S23+''': {{convert|6.6|in|mm|abbr=on}} {{resx|2340|1080}} (393 ppi), 19.5:9 aspect ratio, 120 Hz | '''S23 Ultra''': {{convert|6.8|in|mm|abbr=on}} {{resx|3088|1440}} (500 ppi), 19.3:9 aspect ratio, 120 Hz LTPO }} | ext_display = [[Always on Display|Always on]] | rear_camera = |'''S23/S23+''': 50 MP, f/1.8, 23mm (wide), 1/1.56", 1.0µm, Dual Pixel PDAF, OIS|10 MP, f/2.4, 70mm (telephoto), 1/3.94", 1.0µm, PDAF, 3x optical zoom|12 MP, f/2.2, 13mm, 120˚ (ultrawide), 1/2.55" 1.4µm, Super Steady video|'''S23 Ultra''': 200 MP, f/1.7, 23mm (wide), 1/1.3", 0.6µm, PDAF, Laser AF, OIS|10 MP, f/4.9, 230mm (periscope telephoto), 1/3.52", 1.12µm, dual pixel PDAF, OIS, 10x optical zoom|10 MP, f/2.4, 70mm (telephoto), 1/3.52", 1.12µm, dual pixel PDAF, OIS, 3x optical zoom|12 MP, f/2.2, 13mm, 120˚ (ultrawide), 1/2.55", 1.4µm, dual pixel PDAF | front_camera = {{unbulleted list | 12 MP, f/2.2, 25mm (wide), PDAF | Dual video call, Auto-HDR, HDR10+ | 4K@30/60fps, 1080p@30fps }} | sound = [[Dolby Atmos]] Stereo speakers | connectivity = [[Wi-Fi 7|Wi-Fi 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac/ax/be/7]], dual-band, [[Wi-Fi Direct]], [[Hotspot (Wi-Fi)|hotspot]]
[[Bluetooth#Bluetooth 5.3|Bluetooth 5.3]], A2DP, LE | water_resist = [[IP code|IP68]] water/dust resistance, up to 1.5{{nbsp}}m for 30 minutes | other = | sar = | hac = | website = * [https://www.samsung.com/global/galaxy/galaxy-s23-ultra/ S23 Ultra] * [https://www.samsung.com/global/galaxy/galaxy-s23/ S23 and S23+] * [https://www.samsung.com/us/smartphones/galaxy-s23-fe/ S23 FE] | references = {{cite web |url= https://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_s23-12082.php|title= Samsung Galaxy S23|website= GSMArena|access-date= }}{{cite web |url= https://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_s23+-12083.php|title= Samsung Galaxy S23+|website= GSMArena|access-date= }}{{cite web |url= https://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_s23_ultra-12024.php|title= Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra|website= GSMArena|access-date= }} }} The '''Samsung Galaxy S23''' is a series of high-end [[Android (operating system)|Android]]-based [[smartphone]]s designed, developed, manufactured, and marketed by [[Samsung Electronics]] as part of its flagship [[Samsung Galaxy S series|Galaxy S series]]. The phones were announced and unveiled on 1 February 2023 at the [[Galaxy Unpacked]] in-person event and were released on 17 February 2023.{{cite web |url= https://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_s23_and_s23_announced-news-57403.php|title= Samsung Galaxy S23 and S23+ arrive with new design, bigger batteries|date= 1 February 2023|website= GSMArena|access-date= }}{{cite web |url= https://www.phonearena.com/galaxy-s23-release-date-price-features-news|title= Samsung Galaxy S23 release date, price, features, and news|last= Daniel|first= Petrov|date= 1 February 2023|website= PhoneArena|access-date= }}{{cite web |url= https://www.techadvisor.com/article/783313/samsung-galaxy-s23.html|title= Samsung Galaxy S23: Everything you need to know|last= Dominic|first= Preston|date= 1 February 2023|website= TechAdvisor|access-date= }}{{cite web |url= https://www.techradar.com/news/samsung-galaxy-s23|title= Samsung Galaxy S23: what we know so far|last= James|first= Rogerson|date= 1 February 2023|website= TechRadar|access-date= }}{{cite web |url= https://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_s23_ultra_is_official_with_200mp_camera_and_snapdragon_8_gen_2-news-57398.php|title= Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra is official with 200MP camera and bespoke Snapdragon 8 Gen 2|date= 1 February 2023|website= GSMArena|access-date= }} They collectively serve as the successor to the [[Samsung Galaxy S22]] series. == History == The first three phones in the series- the Samsung Galaxy S23, S23+, and S23 Ultra were announced on 1 February 2023 at the [[Galaxy Unpacked]] event. The Samsung Galaxy S23 FE was announced on Oct. 3, 2023 and was released on October 26, 2023.{{Cite web |last=Johnson |first=Allison |date=2023-10-03 |title=Samsung's new "fan editions" of the Galaxy S23, Tab S9, and Buds bring flagship features to lower prices |url=https://www.theverge.com/2023/10/3/23901275/samsung-galaxy-s23-fe-tab-s9-buds-price-features |access-date=2023-10-04 |website=The Verge |language=en-US}} == Lineup == The Galaxy S23 series includes three devices, which share the same lineup and screen sizes with the previous [[Samsung Galaxy S22|Galaxy S22]] series. The entry-level Galaxy S23 features a flat 6.1-inch (155 mm) display with a [[variable refresh rate]] from 48 Hz to 120 Hz, 8 GB of RAM, and storage options from 128 GB to 512 GB. The Galaxy S23+ features similar hardware in a larger 6.6-inch (168 mm) form factor, storage options starting at 256 GB, faster charging rate and larger battery capacity. At the top of the lineup, the Galaxy S23 Ultra features a curved 6.8-inch (173 mm) display with a variable refresh rate starting at 1 Hz, 8 GB or 12 GB of RAM, storage options from 256 GB to 1 TB, and the largest battery capacity in the lineup. Additionally, it features a more advanced camera setup, a higher-resolution display, and like the previous Galaxy S22 Ultra, an integrated S Pen for increased functionality and productivity. == Design == {{Stack|[[File:Back of the Samsung Galaxy S23.jpg|thumb|Back of the Samsung Galaxy S23 Cream (right), S23+ Lavender (center), and S23 Ultra Green (left)]]}} All models in the Samsung Galaxy S23 series are available in four standard colors: Cream, Lavender, Green, and Phantom Black, with four additional colors available only at samsung.com: Graphite and Lime, and the Galaxy S23 Ultra exclusives Red and Sky Blue.{{cite web |url= https://www.tomsguide.com/news/samsung-galaxy-s23-colors|title= Samsung Galaxy S23 colors — here are your options|last= Richard|first= Priday|date= 1 February 2023|website= Tom's Guide|access-date= }}{{cite web |url= https://www.phonearena.com/news/galaxy-s23-colors_id143167|title= Galaxy S23 colors: all the official hues|last= Iskra|first= Petrova|date= 1 February 2023|website= PhoneArena|access-date= }} == Specifications == === Hardware === ==== Chipset ==== Unlike the Samsung Galaxy S22 and previous generations, which in some African and all European countries utilized Samsung's own [[Exynos]] chip, the Galaxy S23 series uses the Qualcomm's [[List of Qualcomm Snapdragon systems on chips#Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 (2023)|Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 for Galaxy]] chip worldwide. The Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 for Galaxy, which is a special version of the Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 developed specifically for Samsung,{{Cite web |title=Promo images feature a new 'Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 for Galaxy' logo |url=https://www.gsmarena.com/promo_images_feature_a_new_snapdragon_8_gen_2_for_galaxy_logo-news-57362.php |access-date=2 February 2023 |website=GSMArena.com |language=en-US}}{{Cite web |title=Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 Mobile Platform |url=https://www.qualcomm.com/products/application/smartphones/snapdragon-8-series-mobile-platforms/snapdragon-8-gen-2-mobile-platform |access-date=2 February 2023 |website=qualcomm.com |language=en}} includes an Octa-Core CPU and an [[Adreno]] 740 GPU with a Qualcomm X70 modem for connectivity. The difference between the regular version of the Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 compared to the Samsung version is that the Samsung version features an overclocked Cortex-X3 core at 3.36 GHz instead of 3.20 GHz, and the Adreno 740 GPU has been overclocked to 719 MHz instead of 680 MHz.{{Cite web |title=What is the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 for Galaxy? Everything you need to know |url=https://www.zdnet.com/article/what-is-the-qualcomm-snapdragon-8-gen-2-for-galaxy-everything-you-need-to-know/ |access-date=2 February 2023 |publisher=ZDNet |language=en}} ==== Display ==== The Galaxy S23 series features a "Dynamic [[AMOLED]] 2X" display with [[HDR10+]] support, 1750 nits of peak brightness, and "dynamic tone mapping" technology. All models use an ultrasonic in-screen [[fingerprint sensor]].{{Cite web|title=Specs {{!}} Samsung Galaxy S23 vs S23+ vs S23 Ultra|url= https://www.samsung.com/global/galaxy/galaxy-s23-ultra/specs/|access-date=1 February 2023|website=Samsung Global|language=en}} {| class="wikitable" ! Model || [[Display size]] || [[Display resolution|Resolution]] || [[Pixel density|Density]] || [[Display aspect ratio|Aspect ratio]] || Max [[refresh rate]] || [[Variable refresh rate]] || Shape |- | S23 || {{convert|6.1|in|0|abbr=on}} || rowspan="2" | 2340×1080 || ~425 ppi || rowspan="2" | 19.5:9 || rowspan="3" | 120 Hz || rowspan="2" | 48 Hz to 120 Hz || rowspan="2" | Rounded corners, flat sides |- | S23+ || {{convert|6.6|in|0|abbr=on}} || ~393 ppi |- | S23 Ultra || {{convert|6.8|in|0|abbr=on}} || 3088×1440 || ~500 ppi || 19.3:9 || 1 Hz to 120 Hz || Sharp corners, curved sides |} ==== Cameras ==== The Galaxy S23 and S23+ have a 50 MP wide sensor, a 10 MP telephoto sensor and a 12 MP ultrawide sensor. The S23 Ultra has a 200 MP wide sensor, two 10 MP telephoto sensors and a 12 MP ultrawide sensor. The front camera uses a 12 MP sensor on all three models. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |+Camera comparison on the Galaxy S23 series ! colspan="2" |Models !Galaxy S23 & S23+ !Galaxy S23 Ultra |- ! rowspan="2" |Wide !Specs |50 MP, f/1.8, 24 mm, 1/1.56", Dual Pixel PDAF, OIS |200 MP, f/1.7, 24 mm, 1/1.3", PDAF, Laser AF, OIS |- !Model |Samsung S5KGN3 |Samsung S5KHP2 |- ! rowspan="2" |Ultrawide !Specs | colspan="2" |12 MP, f/2.2, 13 mm, 1/2.55", Dual Pixel PDAF on S23 Ultra |- !Model | colspan="2" |Sony IMX564 |- ! rowspan="2" |Telephoto !Specs |10 MP, f/2.4, 70 mm, 1/3.94", PDAF, OIS, 3x optical zoom |10 MP, f/2.4, 70 mm, 1/3.52", Dual Pixel PDAF, OIS, 3x optical zoom |- !Model |Samsung S5K3K1 |Sony IMX754 |- ! rowspan="2" |[[Periscope lens|Periscope Telephoto]] !Specs |rowspan="2" |– |10 MP, f/4.9, 240 mm, 1/3.52", Dual Pixel PDAF, OIS, 10x optical zoom |- !Model |Sony IMX754 |- ! rowspan="2" |Front !Specs | colspan="2" |12 MP, f/2.2, 26 mm, 1/3.24", PDAF |- !Model | colspan="2" |Samsung S5K3LU |} ==== Connectivity ==== Samsung Galaxy S23, S23+, and S23 Ultra support [[5G]] SA/NSA/Sub6, Wi-Fi 6E, and [[Bluetooth 5.3]] connectivity. ==== Memory and storage ==== The Samsung Galaxy S23 offers 8 GB of RAM and 128 GB, 256 GB, and in some regions, 512 GB of internal storage options. The Galaxy S23+ offers 8 GB of RAM and 256 GB and 512 GB of internal storage options. The Galaxy S23 Ultra has 8 GB or 12 GB of RAM and 256 GB, 512 GB, and 1 TB of internal storage options. The 128 GB version of the Galaxy S23 uses the older [[UFS 3.1]] storage format, while versions with 256 GB and more use the newer, faster and more efficient [[UFS 4.0]].{{Cite web |date=30 January 2023 |title=128GB Samsung Galaxy S23 to use slower UFS 3.1 storage |url=https://www.gsmarena.com/128gb_samsung_galaxy_s23_to_use_the_old_ufs_31_storage-news-57375.php |access-date=8 February 2023 |website=GSMArena.com |language=en-US}} {| class="wikitable" ! rowspan="2" |Models ! colspan="2" |Galaxy S23 ! colspan="2" |Galaxy S23+ ! colspan="2" |Galaxy S23 Ultra |- ![[Random Access Memory|RAM]] !Storage ![[Random Access Memory|RAM]] !Storage ![[Random Access Memory|RAM]] !Storage |- !Variant 1 |8{{Nbsp}}GB |128{{Nbsp}}GB | – | – |8{{Nbsp}}GB |256{{Nbsp}}GB |- !Variant 2 |8{{Nbsp}}GB |256{{Nbsp}}GB |8{{Nbsp}}GB |256{{Nbsp}}GB |12{{Nbsp}}GB |256{{Nbsp}}GB |- !Variant 3 |8{{Nbsp}}GB |512{{Nbsp}}GB |8{{Nbsp}}GB |512{{Nbsp}}GB |12{{Nbsp}}GB |512{{Nbsp}}GB |- !Variant 4 | – | – | – | – |12{{Nbsp}}GB |1{{Nbsp}}TB |} ==== Batteries ==== The Galaxy S23, S23+, and S23 Ultra contain non-removable 3,900 mAh, 4,700 mAh, and 5,000 mAh [[Lithium-ion|Li-ion]] batteries respectively.{{cite web |url= https://www.ifixit.com/Teardown/Galaxy+S23+Teardown/158006|title= Galaxy S23 Teardown|website= iFixit|last= Alfani|first= Andrea|date= 17 February 2023}} The S23 supports wired charging over [[USB-C]] at up to 25W (using [[USB hardware#USB Power Delivery|USB Power Delivery]]) while the S23+ and S23 Ultra have faster 45W charging, branded by Samsung as "Super Fast Charging 2.0" .{{cite web |url= https://www.dukakeen.com/product/samsung-galaxy-s23-ultra-5g-1tb-green-price-in-bahrain//|title= Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra battery |date= 14 February 2023|website= Dukakeen|access-date= }} All three have [[Qi (standard)|Qi]] inductive charging up to 15W. The phones also have the ability to charge other Qi-compatible devices from the S23's own battery power, which is branded as "Wireless PowerShare," at up to 4.5W.{{cite web |url= https://www.phonearena.com/news/samsung-galaxy-S23-battery_id143280|title= Samsung Galaxy S23 battery life|last= Victor|first= Haristov|date= 1 February 2023|website= PhoneArena|access-date= }} === Software === The Samsung Galaxy S23 phones were released with [[Android 13]] with Samsung's [[One UI]] 5.1 software. [[Samsung Knox]] is included for enhanced device security, and a separate version exists for enterprise use. Samsung has promised 4 years of major Android OS updates and 1 additional year of security updates for a total of 5 years worth of updates.{{Cite web |last1=SamMobile |last2=Matei |first2=Mihai |date=1 February 2023 |title=How many updates will the Samsung Galaxy S23 series get? |url=https://www.sammobile.com/news/how-many-updates-samsung-galaxy-s23-series/ |access-date=2 February 2023 |website=SamMobile |language=en-US}} == Controversies == On 10 March, a [[Reddit]] user made a post accusing Samsung of using [[artificial intelligence]] to digitally enhance photos of the [[moon]] with its 'Scene Optimizer' feature, which was introduced with the [[Samsung Galaxy S10]]. Replying to the controversy, Samsung issued an article in which it explains that it used variety of processes such as "Scene Optimiser", "AI Deep Learning" and "Super Resolution" to apply multi frame processing to enhance the moon.{{Cite web |last=Allison|first=Johnson|date=11 March 2023 |title=Samsung's Moon photos are fake — but so is a lot of mobile photography |url=https://www.theverge.com/2023/3/14/23640006/samsung-s23-moon-photo-controversy-space-zoom-computational-photography/ |access-date=11 March 2023 |website=[[The Verge]] |language=en-US}} == Gallery == Samsung Galaxy S23 Series.jpg|Samsung Galaxy S23 series Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra, 512 GB, Lavender 20230416 HOF00318 RAW-Export cens.png|Back view of the Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra, 512 GB, Lavender mit S-Pen 20230416 HOF00335 RAW-Export cens.png|S23 Ultra with its [[S Pen]] Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra, 512 GB, Lavender 20230416 HOF00358 RAW-Export.png|The protruding cameras of the S23 Ultra == See also == * [[List of longest smartphone telephoto lenses]] == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * [https://www.samsung.com/global/galaxy/galaxy-s23/ Samsung Galaxy S23 & S23+] – Official website * [https://www.samsung.com/global/galaxy/galaxy-s23-ultra/ Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra] – Official website * [https://www.samsung.com/us/smartphones/galaxy-s23-fe/ Samsung Galaxy S23 FE] – Official website {{S-start}} {{S-bef| before = [[Samsung Galaxy S22]]}} {{S-ttl| title = Samsung Galaxy S23| years = 2023}} {{S-inc| recent}} {{S-end}} {{Samsung phones}} {{Samsung Galaxy S|smartphones=yes|tablets =yes}} [[Category:Android (operating system) devices]] [[Category:Samsung Galaxy]] [[Category:Flagship smartphones]] [[Category:Samsung smartphones]] [[Category:Mobile phones with multiple rear cameras]] [[Category:Mobile phones with 8K video recording]] [[Category:Mobile phones introduced in 2023]]
